snippet: Alex Rodriguez, 37 and owed at least $114 million for the next five seasons, can still contribute to victories, just not, perhaps, in the way the Yankees once expected.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column asserts that New York Yankees may need to change their expectations for third baseman Alex Rodriguez, who is owed at least $114 million for five seasons remaining on his contract; suggests that the aging slugger can still contribute to victories, perhaps just not in the way the Yankees once hoped.
lead_paragraph: Alex Rodriguez, 37 and owed at least $114 million for the next five seasons, can still contribute to victories, just not, perhaps, in the way the Yankees once expected.

headline.seo: It May Be Time to Adjust Expectations for Yankees’ Alex Rodriguez
headline.main: Time to Change Expectations for Aging Slugger
headline.print_headline: Time to Change Expectations For Aging Slugger
